brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of a common herbal remedy, St. John's
      Wort, on the effectiveness of birth control pills. St. John's Wort has recently been shown
      to increase metabolism of some drugs. If it could increase metabolism of oral contraceptives
      as well, it may increase the risk of contraceptive failure and unintended pregnancy. Study
      participants will be evaluated for risk of ovulation on oral contraceptives before and
      during simultaneous therapy with St. John's Wort.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of St. John's Wort on the Effectiveness of Oral Contraceptives

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Women taking or willing to take low dose oral contraceptives for 5 months

          -  No contraindications to hormonal contraception

facility.name: Columbia University Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Hypericum Perforatum on Effectiveness of Oral Contraceptives

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: National Center for Complementary and Alternative Medicine (NCCAM)

lead_sponsor.agency: National Center for Complementary and Alternative Medicine (NCCAM)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics/Dynamics Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind, Primary Purpose: Treatment
